claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Gregory House , M.D. , commonly referred to by his surname House , is the title character of the American medical drama series House .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Created by David Shore and portrayed by English actor Hugh Laurie , he leads a team of diagnosticians as the Head of Diagnostic Medicine at the fictional Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital in Princeton , New Jersey  (  based on the real-life Yale -- New Haven Hospital in New Haven , Connecticut  )  .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: House 's character has been described as a misanthrope , cynic , narcissist , and curmudgeon , the last of which was named one of the top television words of 2005 in honor of the character .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He is the only character to appear in all 177 episodes and , except for Wilson 's brief appearance , is the only regular character to appear in the season six premiere .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In the series , the character 's unorthodox diagnostic approaches , radical therapeutic motives , and stalwart rationality have resulted in much conflict between him and his colleagues .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: House is also often portrayed as lacking sympathy for his patients , a practice that allots him time to solve pathological enigmas .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The character is partly inspired by Sherlock Holmes .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: A portion of the show 's plot centers on House 's habitual use of Vicodin to manage pain stemming from a leg infarction involving his quadriceps muscle some years earlier , an injury that forces him to walk with a cane .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: This addiction is also one of the many parallels to Holmes , who was a habitual user of cocaine .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Throughout the series ' run , the character received generally positive reviews and was included in several best lists .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Tom Shales of The Washington Post called House `` the most electrifying character to hit television in years '' .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: For his portrayal , Laurie has won various awards , including two Golden Globe Awards for Best Actor in a Television Series -- Drama , two Screen Actors Guild Awards for Best Actor from Drama Series , two Satellite Awards for Best Actor in a Television Series -- Drama , two TCA Awards for Individual Achievement in Drama , and a total of six Primetime Emmy Award nominations for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series .

premise_source_doc_sentence: The series ' main character is Dr. Gregory House  (  Hugh Laurie  )  , an unconventional , misanthropic medical genius who , despite his dependence on pain medication , leads a team of diagnosticians at the fictional Princeton -- Plainsboro Teaching Hospital  (  PPTH  )  in New Jersey .

claim: Robert Chase worked under a fictional character Gregory House.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In seasons 1 through 3 , House 's diagnostic team includes Dr. Allison Cameron  (  Jennifer Morrison  )  , Dr. Robert Chase  (  Jesse Spencer  )  and Dr. Eric Foreman  (  Omar Epps  )  .
